ygData.subject: Re: [neat] Connection weight mutation schemes
ygData.msgSnippet: ... See my reply to Yuri! ... I think we re all getting carried away a bit here. As Derek points out, the parameters probably don t effect a search that much

Ian Badcoe wrote:

>	Another take on this is something I've pondered about for GP, and which is 
>inspired by nature.  In nature, not all parts of a chromosome exhibit equal 
>mutation rates. 
>
See my reply to Yuri!

>	Node creation would then be, I guess, a probability on each connection, 
>maybe (waves hands vaguely)...
>  
>
I think we're all getting carried away a bit here. As Derek points out, 
the parameters probably don't effect a search that much anyway so 
co-evolving parameters will probbaly cause them to drift all over the 
shop, whilst having the same effect as the far simpler system we started 
out with! Probably the best we can hope for is to discover some 'ball 
park' numbers for each of a given set of problem domains - so we can 
just pick a set that is best suited to a given problem domain each time 
we want to do a search.

Perhaps there is a case to be made for varying the NEAT parameters as a 
search progresses, as the search shifts from wide ranging exploration of 
the search space over to refinement, but full fledged co-evolution of 
neat parameters seems like overkill.

Again, sorry for being a naysayer :(

>	As an aside, this also gives us another angle on modularity, since a 
>useful module should have a net mutability which has dropped quite low, and 
>one might also want to allow a quite different value for the probability of 
>intra-module connection formation vs. inter-module connection formation...
>  
>
Yeh fair point. Or you could just have two sets of params, one for 
normal connections and one for connections that are part of a module 
instance.

>(*) I think it is "Evolution Strategy" (ES).  I checked here 
>http://www.cs.bham.ac.uk/Mirrors/ftp.de.uu.net/EC/clife/www/top.htm), but 
>it's too heavy for me to (re)comprehend in a short time.
>  
>
Hmm, that's the 2nd time Hitchikers guide as come up this evening. It's 
a shame the EC FAQ  hasn't been updated for 4 years huh.

Colin
